complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the initialization process into: (1) Creating the Next.js project with TypeScript and App Router, (2) Installing Tailwind CSS v4, (3) Installing and configuring shadcn/ui, (4) Installing Lucide React, React Hook Form, Zod, and Resend, (5) Configuring Tailwind and shadcn/ui according to documentation.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This task is moderately complex due to the number of dependencies and configuration steps, but each step is well-documented and follows standard setup procedures for modern Next.js projects.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Implement oklch CSS Variable Theme in app/globals.css
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand into: (1) Adding oklch CSS variables to globals.css, (2) Updating Tailwind config to use these variables, (3) Testing color inheritance in shadcn/ui components, (4) Verifying color contrast with Lighthouse.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Requires CSS variable management, Tailwind configuration, and accessibility validation, which introduces some complexity beyond basic styling.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Scaffold All 10 Landing Page Sections as React Components
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Divide into: (1) Creating placeholder components for each section, (2) Integrating semantic HTML5 and ARIA roles, (3) Rendering all components in the main page for structure verification.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: While repetitive, this task involves careful adherence to structure, naming, and accessibility conventions.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Populate Components with Verbatim Marketing Copy and Static Assets
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Split into: (1) Inserting marketing copy into each component, (2) Adding placeholder images, videos, and icons, (3) Integrating Lucide React icons as specified.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Primarily a data entry and asset placement task, with minimal logic but requiring attention to detail.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Implement Responsive Layouts and Grids for All Sections
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down into: (1) Implementing responsive grid/flex layouts for each section, (2) Testing layouts on desktop, tablet, and mobile, (3) Ensuring no horizontal scrolling, (4) Verifying with device emulation tools, (5) Running visual regression and Lighthouse audits.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: High complexity due to the need for custom responsive layouts for each section and thorough cross-device testing.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Integrate shadcn/ui Components and Lucide Icons
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand into: (1) Replacing placeholders with shadcn/ui components, (2) Integrating Lucide icons in relevant sections, (3) Ensuring keyboard accessibility for all interactive elements, (4) Running accessibility checks.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Requires component replacement, icon integration, and accessibility validation, which increases complexity.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Implement Sticky Navigation Bar with Smooth Scrolling
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Divide into: (1) Building the sticky navigation bar, (2) Implementing opacity transitions on scroll, (3) Adding smooth scrolling to sections, (4) Ensuring accessibility and ARIA labeling.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Involves both UI behavior and accessibility, but is a common pattern with established solutions.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Optimize and Integrate Final Visual Assets (Video, GIFs, Logos, Headshots)
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down into: (1) Optimizing videos and GIFs to modern formats, (2) Compressing and preparing all assets, (3) Replacing placeholders with final assets, (4) Implementing lazy loading and fallbacks, (5) Running performance audits.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Asset optimization and integration require technical knowledge and careful testing for performance and compatibility.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Develop Contact Form with React Hook Form and Zod Validation
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand into: (1) Building the form UI with shadcn/ui, (2) Integrating React Hook Form for state management, (3) Implementing Zod schema validation, (4) Adding real-time validation and error messages, (5) Ensuring accessibility and writing unit tests.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Form development with validation and accessibility is non-trivial and requires both frontend and validation logic.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Create /api/request-demo Endpoint with Server-side Zod Validation and Resend Integration
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Divide into: (1) Creating the API route, (2) Implementing server-side Zod validation, (3) Formatting HTML email templates, (4) Integrating Resend API with secure env vars, (5) Handling HTTP status codes, (6) Writing integration tests and mocking Resend.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This backend task involves API development, validation, email formatting, third-party integration, and robust testing, making it one of the most complex.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Implement SEO Metadata and Open Graph Tags Using Next.js Metadata API
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand into: (1) Adding SEO metadata and Open Graph tags in page.tsx, (2) Ensuring canonical URL and social sharing image, (3) Verifying with browser dev tools and SEO audit tools.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: SEO metadata implementation is straightforward with Next.js Metadata API, but requires attention to detail.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down into: (1) Auditing semantic HTML and ARIA attributes, (2) Checking color contrast and alt text, (3) Testing keyboard navigation, (4) Running automated accessibility audits, (5) Manual screen reader testing.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Accessibility compliance requires thorough review, testing, and potentially refactoring, making it a high-complexity task.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Implement Performance Optimization: SSG/ISR, Asset Lazy Loading, and Budget Enforcement
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand into: (1) Configuring SSG/ISR in Next.js, (2) Implementing lazy loading for images/videos, (3) Compressing and converting assets, (4) Monitoring Core Web Vitals, (5) Running and analyzing Lighthouse/Web Vitals audits.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Performance optimization involves multiple advanced techniques and ongoing measurement, requiring significant expertise.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Deploy to Vercel and Configure Environment Variables
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Divide into: (1) Pushing code to GitHub and connecting to Vercel, (2) Setting environment variables securely, (3) Testing production deployment for asset/API integrity, (4) Running end-to-end tests and checking logs.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Deployment is a standard DevOps task but requires careful configuration and verification for production readiness.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Implement A/B Testing for Hero CTA Using Vercel Edge Config
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand into: (1) Setting up Vercel Edge Config for CTA variants, (2) Implementing logic to serve variants, (3) Tracking conversion events, (4) Analyzing results for statistical significance.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: A/B testing with Edge Config involves both infrastructure and analytics, requiring careful implementation and validation.
